title: Will Intel lay off more than 15% of its workforce by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Intel lays off more than 15% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The layoffs must be officially confirmed by Intel through a public announcement or reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

article_information.article_description: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…

title: Will India finalize a $300 million loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if India finalizes a $300 million loan to Vietnam specifically for maritime security by August 31, 2024. The finalization must be officially confirmed by either the Indian or Vietnamese government through a public announcement or official document. If no such confirmation is made by that date, the question resolves as NO.

article_information.article_description: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. title: Will the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits exceed 249,000 in any week by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits exceeds 249,000 in any week between now and August 31, 2024. The data must be reported by the U.S. Department of Labor or another reputable source.

title: Will a rule banning airlines from charging parents to sit with their children be implemented by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is implemented that bans airlines from charging parents to sit with their children 13 years old or younger. The rule must be officially enacted and applicable to U.S. and foreign carriers operating in the United States.
